data.title: Who doesn't love a fire truck?
data.text: Fun and interesting facts for the whole family.  There's plenty to see for young and not so young.  Plenty of good Memphis history.  But I like the old fire trucks the best.

data.title: Family Fun - Children Friendly
data.text: My grandsons love this museum.  We spent half a day there and they were never ready to leave.  The staff is helpful and it is truly kid friendly

data.title: Fine place for history
data.text: Museum is good and has lots of information for people wanting to see fire equipment and similar items. Needs a minor update, and gift shop is to expensive but other that that is a good 2 hour detour to have fun at.

data.title: fab place
data.text: not sure if its everyone's cup of tea but i went here as my son is a fireman and pop in here to pick up a T-shirt for him , while there we had a tour of the place and got to meet a fireman that was part of the 9/11 ....we  also got to meet the  fire dog Izzy ..

data.title: hot spot
data.text: great place to visit, nice collection of equipment and its hands on very interesting .I say go and look, enjoy

data.title: The finest Fire Museum in the USA!
data.text:
Not only are there antique equipment inside, the museum is hands on and very educational. They have Fire educators on staff to train you how to get out of Fire alive. The exhibits are the best in the country. To begin your tour you enter and listen to a "Disney Like" character named Old Billy- a full size fire horse with a video to explain the museum. 

The FMOM is located in an old fire station that was around from the early 1900's   

There are 2 parts to the museum , a new section that has old equipment as well as exhibits and gift shop. On the second floor of the new part , you have a large party room for all sizes of private parties. Downstairs can accommodate birthday parties for your children. 

Outside is a beautiful structure for Firefighters killed in the line of duty, a Memorial Wall. 

This is a must visit while in Memphis, along with Graceland, Bass Pro and other great attractions as well as the best BBQ in the country. 

Henry B.

owner_response.author: penny s, General Manager at Fire Museum of Memphis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, Henry B., for the wonderful critique of our museum!  We certainly feel the same and love the fact that we are not your ordinary fire museum!  Our focus is two fold, we love our Memphis Firefighters, all firefighters and support personnel!  But we love our citizens too and gear our museum to educate in a fun filled environment.  We call it edutainment!  Please come again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Friendly Staff, Great Museum
data.text:
We hadn't planned on visiting the Fire Museum of Memphis, in fact we didn't even know it existed until we saw it while driving to our hotel.  But, I'm glad that we changed our schedule to fit it in.

We got there first thing in the morning and very few people had made their way there.  The staff was incredibly friendly and overly eager to make sure that we enjoyed our visit.  There were several Memphis firefighters present, all of which were eager to point us in the right direction.

The museum itself was great.  It was very clean and, though fairly small, packed with great exhibits.  Our toddler had a blast running around and playing with all of the interactive exhibits.  And, though I'm ashamed to admit it, I had to fight him a few times so that I could play with some of the stuff.

Overall, I'd highly recommend making time for the Fire Museum of Memphis.  We thoroughly enjoyed our visit!

owner_response.author: penny s, General Manager at Fire Museum of Memphis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, Justin, for your kind comments!  I will forward your remarks to the staff.  We hope you get to come back on your next trip to Memphis!  Sincerely, Penny Smith, General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A fun place to bring the kids and grandkids!
data.text: Kids can climb all over old fire trucks and use their imagination.  When we took our grandsons there, their Dad showed one of the boys how to ring a fire alarm. Later, a group of rowdy teenagers came in - up to the 2nd floor where the fire alarm was located. Our grandson was not pleased with their behavior, so he set off the fire alarm and those rowdy teens scampered down the stairs quick as lightning! Busted by a 7 year old!

owner_response.author: penny s, General Manager at Fire Museum of Memphis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: LOL!  We were proud to have you with us!  Sounds like we have a future firefighter in our midst!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A hidden gem
data.text: If you like firetrucks or wish to educate youngsters in your family you will truly enjoy this attraction.  It is a relatively small museum but the content is excellent and well-maintained.

owner_response.author: penny s, General Manager at Fire Museum of Memphis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, panaxq!  Please come again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Well worth the stop.
data.text: We were very surprised at how nice this visit was. The kids had a ton of fun and so did we. If you are in the downtown Memphis area do yourself a favor and stop by, the stop only takes about an hour.

owner_response.author: penny s, General Manager at Fire Museum of Memphis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, Jim W.!  Please come again and look for our upcoming Breakfast With Santa.  We have a ball with Santa coming in on a fire truck!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A must
data.text: This is one of the best museums in the country.  For anyone that has a interest in the history of the fire service this is a "must see".  The museum is very well organized and very complete.

owner_response.author: penny s, General Manager at Fire Museum of Memphis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your kind words!  Please come again, Glenn!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Really neat museum
data.text: My teenage son is a firefighter and wanted to check out this museum on our yearly trip to Memphis.  I have to say I wasn't excited to go but once we got there I was glad we went.  There is so much history packed into this museum.  Highly recommend everyone visit whether you have an interest in firefighting or not.  We will definitely make sure we make it back for another visit in the future.

owner_response.author: penny s, General Manager at Fire Museum of Memphis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your positive review!  I always tell people we are the best kept secret in Memphis!  We were created to impact a high fire fatality rate in Memphis and through the years have become recognized in the Fire Service as the go-to fire museum to emulate.  It is a privilege to know we impact lives through edutainment.  Please let us know when you are back through Memphis.  We would love to say hi!  Penny Smith, General Manager, Fire Museum of Memphis
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Highlight of my son's visit
data.text: Visited on 7/8/2016. Started off with a warm greeting from the staff. History of the Memphis Fire Department is well represented. We enjoyed the fire room (simulated fire) to the hands on exhibits. My son loved playing on the fire trucks (okay I did too)! Easily worth the price of admission.  As a bonus a dalmatian service dog was there when we were.

data.title: Thank you for your Service
data.text: Stopped by to get our Firefighter Son a Memphis Fire T Shirt!  This is a great place to take your children to be educated on fire safety!

owner_response.author: penny s, General Manager at Fire Museum of Memphis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to say so!  Hope your son enjoys his T-Shirt.  Please stop in again and visit with us!  Happy Independence Day!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazing to see...
data.text: This is a must see. Everything from equipment to old fire engines, there is a kids area and you get to drive the simulator truck to the fire. Sit inside a house on fire and feel the temperature rise. The staff is so friendly and have lots of info about the museum and Memphis. There's a 911 tribute wall there right now, which is worth checking out.

owner_response.author: penny s, General Manager at Fire Museum of Memphis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so very much for your positive response!  We love hearing we are doing things right!  We created a museum to honor our Memphis and Shelby County Firefighters in the surrounding areas, but also stepped outside the box to create a life saving museum for our visitors, one that is fun for the entire family.  Please come again as we are adding to our exhibits all the time!  My best, Penny Smith, General Manager, Fire Museum of Memphis
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fun place for young kids
data.text: Small but fun for the young kids. A lot of hands on a activities for them. My son is 8 years old and he had a blast. My husband turned into a big kid himself.

owner_response.author: penny s, General Manager at Fire Museum of Memphis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you!  We were so glad you stopped by.  The Children's Play Area is definitely for "children of all ages!"  Please come again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Children and Adults Love this place!
data.text: Great location of birthday parties as the children dress in the firemen uniforms, jump in a truck and drive to the fire. There is so much interactive fun! There is even more education and historical equipment and materials to view. It is special to my heart as my great great grandfather's uniform is on exhibit as well as the first coal burning engine that he was responsible for. The children and adults alike will enjoy this visit.

data.title: Fire museum
data.text: Very cool place. My husband is a firefighter so we decided to stop by here and check it out one afternoon. The first room has a some interesting and historic apparatus and fire prevention. The main building has some great hands on activities for kids. Lots of fire prevention for them and some interesting historical information for the parents. They have a simulator to drive a fire truck with all of the fun sirens to accompany it. Some games to help "fight fires" and a smaller fire pile for the kids to climb down. The only thing we didn't get to do was the fire room simulator which k was a bit bummed about. But still a great visit.

data.title: Fire dept
data.text: A great building but in a area not too sure the whole area needs looking at regeneration is a must but for fire men please visit the station and see the the hall of fame for those who gave their lives

data.title: Way Cool Place
data.text: We found it by accident just walking around but our brother in law is a retired fire fighter so we went inside and so glad we did.  So clean and cool.  We didn't take the tour but looked around and had a nice souvenir shop.  Just a short walk from the Mississippi River.
